intro: Enteropogon acicularis, commonly known as the spear grass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear pale yellow to brown flowers. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Enteropogon acicularis is an important plant in traditional Indigenous Australian practices and ecological systems.
